intro: Muricococcum, commonly known as the Australian thornapple, is a genus of flowering plants native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plants are characterized by their woody stems, simple leaves, and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Muricococcum species often grow in dry, sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. They are sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to their unique appearance and resilience.
